intro: Waitzia tenella, commonly known as the slender horned violets, is a species of flowering plant in the family Violaceae. It is characterized by its small, violet-colored flowers and heart-shaped leaves. Native to the southeastern United States, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant has a short, rhizomatous root system that helps it spread vegetatively. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory flora in its native habitat.
